name: Braai-Spiced Pork Chops with Creamy Mushroom Sauce and Roasted Green Beans
description: Quick-seared pork chops seasoned with braai spice get a silky mushroom-cream pan sauce, served alongside oven-roasted green beans. Mild, family-friendly, and weeknight fast.
prep_steps: Trim the ends from the green beans.
Peel and finely chop the garlic.
Pat pork chops dry with paper towels; season both sides with salt, pepper, and braai spice mix.
cook_steps: Toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and pepper; spread on a baking tray.
Roast green beans for 12–15 minutes until tender-crisp, tossing once halfway.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear pork chops 3–4 minutes per side until nicely browned and cooked through (internal temp 63°C/145°F); transfer to a plate to rest.
Reduce heat to medium; add 1 tbsp butter to the skillet.
Add mushrooms and cook 4–5 minutes until browned and any liquid reduces.
Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in chicken stock and simmer 1–2 minutes, scraping the pan.
Lower heat and stir in cream; simmer 2–3 minutes until slightly thickened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Off heat, swirl in remaining 1 tbsp butter for gloss. Return pork chops to the pan and spoon sauce over.
Serve pork chops with creamy mushroom sauce and roasted green beans.
